messages: b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:20): when i ":map g @q" and then type "g" there's a half-second delay before the recorded sequence of commands runs, while if i type "@q" by itself it works instantly
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (13:20): you have another mapping that starts with g
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (13:21): in fact there's a whole bunch of builtins that start with g
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:21): is there a way i can list what mappings are completely free?  (and what mappings i already have, while i'm at it)
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (13:22): vim guarentees no built in mappings start with <Leader>
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:23): if i ":map \ @q" and then type "\" it still takes a half-second before the recorded sequence of commands runs
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (13:24): do you have any plugins or such? <Leader> is oft-used there because of it's non built-in status
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:26): well, i just did "mv $HOME/.vimrc $HOME/.vimrc.old" and "mv $HOME/.vim $HOME/.vim.old" and still get the half-second delay when i type "\"
0bd36436820524a652679131b48c0b92 (13:29): (i seem to be getting the NetrwBrowse plugin automatically loaded in 7, which is why i asked)
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:30): well, when i type ":map \" i get a huge list
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:32): oh wait, that was after i'd put .vim and .vimrc back
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:33): without the .vim and .vimrc i only have "n  \bug          :call <SNR>10_FindGetBugSummary(getline("."), col("."))<CR>" listed when i type ":map \"
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:35): i wonder if mapping a function key would have the same delay
b3422cfd2b99a267abc89cdfd04114c0 (13:36): thanks for your help, sqweek
